description: Strategy Question Answering - Multi-hop implicit reasoning using world knowledge

questions.question: Can a blue whale fit through the doors of a standard house?
reasoning_steps: Blue whales are approximately 100 feet long and 8+ feet wide
Standard house doors are about 6.5 feet tall and 3 feet wide
A blue whale cannot fit through such a small opening

questions.question: Is the Eiffel Tower taller than the Statue of Liberty?
reasoning_steps: The Eiffel Tower is about 1,063 feet tall
The Statue of Liberty is about 305 feet tall including its pedestal

questions.question: Can a cheetah outrun a car on a highway?
reasoning_steps: Cheetahs can run up to about 70 mph
Highway speed limits are typically 65-75 mph, and cars can exceed this
Cheetahs can only maintain top speed briefly, while cars can sustain highway speeds

questions.question: Would a vegetarian eat a beef hamburger?
reasoning_steps: Vegetarians don't eat meat
Beef comes from cows and is meat
A vegetarian would not eat a beef hamburger

questions.question: Can you see the Great Wall of China from the Moon?
reasoning_steps: The Great Wall is about 15-30 feet wide
The Moon is about 238,855 miles from Earth
Objects that narrow cannot be seen from such a distance with the naked eye

questions.question: Is water wet?
reasoning_steps: Water is a liquid
Wetness is the property of being covered or saturated with liquid
Water makes things wet and is itself in a wet state

questions.question: Would a penguin survive comfortably in the Sahara Desert?
reasoning_steps: Penguins are adapted to cold climates
The Sahara Desert has extremely hot temperatures
Penguins cannot regulate body heat in hot environments

questions.question: Can a person hold their breath for an hour?
reasoning_steps: Humans need oxygen continuously
The world record for breath-holding is about 24 minutes under extreme conditions
One hour far exceeds human capability

questions.question: Is the sun larger than the Earth?
reasoning_steps: The Sun's diameter is about 864,000 miles
Earth's diameter is about 7,918 miles
The Sun is about 109 times wider than Earth

questions.question: Can an elephant jump?
reasoning_steps: Elephants are the largest land animals, weighing up to 14,000 pounds
Their bone and muscle structure doesn't support jumping
Elephants are the only mammals that cannot jump

questions.question: Would a snowman last all summer in Florida?
reasoning_steps: Snowmen are made of frozen water
Florida summers are hot, often above 90°F
The snowman would melt quickly

questions.question: Can you mail a letter without a stamp?
reasoning_steps: Postal services require payment for delivery
Stamps are proof of postage payment
Letters without stamps are returned or not delivered

questions.question: Is a tomato a fruit?
reasoning_steps: Botanically, fruits develop from flower ovaries and contain seeds
Tomatoes develop from flowers and contain seeds
Tomatoes are botanically classified as fruits

questions.question: Can birds fly backwards?
reasoning_steps: Hummingbirds can fly in all directions including backwards
They have specially adapted wing joints
Therefore, some birds can fly backwards

questions.question: Would a fish survive outside of water for a day?
reasoning_steps: Fish breathe through gills that extract oxygen from water
Gills cannot extract oxygen from air
Fish would suffocate outside water

questions.question: Is Mount Everest taller than Mount Kilimanjaro?
reasoning_steps: Mount Everest is 29,032 feet tall
Mount Kilimanjaro is 19,341 feet tall

questions.question: Can you boil water at room temperature?
reasoning_steps: Boiling point depends on pressure
Under low pressure (vacuum), water boils at lower temperatures
In a vacuum chamber, water can boil at room temperature

questions.question: Does the Amazon River flow through Europe?
reasoning_steps: The Amazon River is in South America
It flows through Brazil, Peru, and other South American countries
It does not reach Europe

questions.question: Can humans see ultraviolet light?
reasoning_steps: Human eyes can only detect visible light spectrum
Ultraviolet light has wavelengths shorter than visible light
Humans cannot see UV light without special equipment

questions.question: Is a whale a fish?
reasoning_steps: Whales are warm-blooded and breathe air
Whales give birth to live young and nurse them
These are mammalian characteristics; whales are mammals, not fish

tier_b.name: Advanced
tier_b.description: 3+ hop reasoning requiring integration of multiple world knowledge facts

questions.question: Would the current President of the United States be considered a millennial?
reasoning_steps: Millennials were born between 1981-1996
Joe Biden was born in 1942
1942 is before the millennial generation

questions.question: Could a ancient Roman have eaten a potato?
reasoning_steps: Ancient Rome existed from 753 BC to 476 AD
Potatoes are native to South America
Potatoes weren't brought to Europe until the 16th century, after Columbus
Ancient Romans lived before potatoes reached Europe

questions.question: Can the Mona Lisa be purchased for any amount of money?
reasoning_steps: The Mona Lisa is owned by the French government
It is considered priceless cultural heritage
French law prohibits the sale of national treasures
It cannot be legally purchased at any price

questions.question: Could you walk from Moscow to Beijing without crossing any water?
reasoning_steps: Both cities are in the Eurasian landmass
There is a continuous land route through Russia, Mongolia, and China
While challenging, no body of water needs to be crossed

questions.question: Would a person born on February 29, 1988, have celebrated 10 birthdays on their actual birthday by 2024?
reasoning_steps: February 29 occurs only in leap years (every 4 years)
That's 9 leap years, so 9 actual birthday celebrations

questions.question: Could Cleopatra have seen the Great Pyramid in its original white limestone casing?
reasoning_steps: Cleopatra lived from 69-30 BC
The Great Pyramid was built around 2560 BC
Much of the white limestone casing had eroded or been removed by Cleopatra's time
The casing stones were largely stripped after earthquakes, especially after 1303 AD

questions.question: If you flew directly west from New York City, would you eventually reach California?
reasoning_steps: New York City is at approximately 41°N latitude
California extends from about 32°N to 42°N latitude
Flying due west from NYC would cross the continental US including California

questions.question: Could a person who was born deaf learn to speak a language?
reasoning_steps: Speech is produced by the vocal apparatus, not hearing
Deaf individuals can learn to speak through speech therapy and visual feedback
Many deaf individuals learn to speak oral languages

questions.question: Would Einstein have been able to watch a color television broadcast?
reasoning_steps: Einstein died in April 1955
Color television broadcasts began in the US in 1951 (CBS) and 1954 (NBC)
Einstein could have watched color TV in his final years

questions.question: Is it possible to sneeze with your eyes open?
reasoning_steps: The reflex to close eyes during sneezing is not absolute
With effort, some people can keep their eyes open while sneezing
The 'eyes will pop out' myth is false

questions.question: Could you fit all of humanity into a space the size of Los Angeles?
reasoning_steps: World population is about 8 billion people
Los Angeles is about 503 square miles or 14+ billion square feet
Each person would have about 1.75 square feet
While very crowded, people could physically fit standing

questions.question: Would a message sent from Earth reach Mars before a Tesla Roadster launched into space could drive there?
reasoning_steps: Radio signals travel at the speed of light (3-22 minutes to Mars depending on position)
SpaceX's Starman Roadster is in solar orbit, not traveling to Mars
Even if it were, the car couldn't actually drive in space
Light-speed signals would arrive first

questions.question: Could Marie Curie have used a computer?
reasoning_steps: Marie Curie died in 1934
The first general-purpose electronic computer (ENIAC) was completed in 1945
Personal computers weren't available until the 1970s-80s
Curie died before modern computers existed

questions.question: Is it possible for two people born 100 years apart to have met each other?
reasoning_steps: If person A was born in 1900 and lived to 105 (dying in 2005)
Person B born in 2000 would be 5 years old when A died
They could have met during their overlapping lifetimes

questions.question: Could Napoleon have sent a telegram?
reasoning_steps: Napoleon died in 1821
The first practical telegraph was invented by Samuel Morse in the 1830s
Commercial telegraph service began in the 1840s
Napoleon died before the telegraph was invented

questions.question: Would a glass of water weigh more on Jupiter than on Earth?
reasoning_steps: Weight = mass × gravitational acceleration
Jupiter's surface gravity is about 2.4 times Earth's
The same mass of water would weigh about 2.4 times more on Jupiter

questions.question: Could you theoretically travel to a star within a human lifetime?
reasoning_steps: At very high speeds, time dilation occurs (special relativity)
From the traveler's perspective, time passes more slowly
A journey to Proxima Centauri at near-light speed would feel much shorter to the traveler
The trip is theoretically possible within a human lifetime from the traveler's reference frame

questions.question: Did the Ottoman Empire exist at the same time as Harvard University?
reasoning_steps: Harvard University was founded in 1636
The Ottoman Empire existed from 1299 to 1922
They overlapped from 1636 to 1922 (286 years)

questions.question: Could a person stand at the North Pole and walk due south, then due east, then due north, and end up at the same spot?
reasoning_steps: Starting at the North Pole, walk south any distance
Walk east (along a latitude line) for any distance
Walk north the same distance as the first leg
Due to the geometry of spherical coordinates, you return to the North Pole

questions.question: Would a gold bar float in a pool of liquid mercury?
reasoning_steps: Gold has a density of about 19.3 g/cm³
Mercury has a density of about 13.5 g/cm³
Wait - gold is denser, so it would sink, not float
Actually, NO - gold would sink in mercury because gold is denser
